question: Some Buddhist rock-cut caves are called chaityas while the others viharas. What is the difference between the two?
option1: Chaitya is a place of worship while vihara is the dwelling place of the monks
option2: Chaitya is the stupa at the far end of the cave while vihara is the hall axial to it
option3: There is no material difference between the two
option4: Vihara is a place of worship while chaitya is the dwelling place of the monks
answer: Chaitya is a place of worship while vihara is the dwelling place of the monks
explanation: The Buddhist architecture is mainly consisting of Chaityas, Viahras, Stupa and Stambhas.  There are mainly two types of distinct architecture related to the caves, i.e. Chaitya and Viharas. Chaityas were the place of worship in Buddhism, whereas Viharas were dwelling place of monks
